title: PRIDE & PREJUDICE (2005) movie title and credits font
content:
Anybody please identify the typeface of ampersand.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131103121551im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NDVD_4478.JPG)
author: Kabir Shah

comments.content:
I think you nailed it here, Paul.  
The ampersand must be from another typeface.  
Probably because the one in Requiem is a bit flimsy.

Its not at all Requiem. Just look at 'M' and 'W'. They are quite different than those of Requiem. Also note that all the characters have the same exact height whereas in Requiem, J is a bit taller, C and D are shorter etc. Also the font used is sharp whereas Requiem has rough surfaces.

Are you sure you looked at Requiem from H&FJ? \* [link](http://web.archive.org/web/20131103121551/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100020)\*  
Cause what you’re saying doesn’t make sense to me.  
And in your sample the ‘J’ _does_ descend below the baseline.

Its Requiem indeed. I got it now. I found a different font named Requiem at Dafont and 1001fonts websites so I was confused.

Thanks a lot.

Can you please tell me what font is used for the '&' in the first image?
Might look like secondary text is also from H&FJ. Geometric "C" and "O" feel like Gotham even at this size.

Please anybody tell me what font is used for the ’&’ in the first image?

Also it would be very helpful if anybody can tell me where I can get Requiem font for free. It costs $199 on H&FJ website which, I think, is too much for personal use.

I have searched Pirate Bay and other torrent websites but haven't found it. If there is anyone who has bought this font, it would be very great of him to share it with me.

Thanks a lot in advance.

You're not going to get any help looking for pirated software here. A lot of the people on these boards are the ones who create and sell the fonts you're looking to rip off.

- Lex

Please anybody tell me what font is used for the ampersand in this image?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131103121551im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NDVD_000_4822.JPG)
You wouldn't happen to have a larger image of it do you?
Please anybody tell me what font is used for the ampersand in the image?

It is a flipped B, with a bit cut out and the tail of a J added. A real DIY-project.

(BTW Kabir, shouting for attention doesn’t work here…)

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

@Kabir Shah

You're at wrong place, between wrong people.

I'm really surprised anyone still wanted to help this guy after  
_I have searched Pirate Bay and other torrent websites but haven’t found it._

Wow. Now that's shameless.

- Filip Łysyszyn

I thank all those people who identified the font for me and all the members of this group for keeping up such a good work.

Honestly, I didn’t know that my words or my actions would cause anyone such annoyance. I liked this font very much and was determined to find it out so I searched for it wherever I could.

I am new to this group and joined it only to identify the font. I didn't know how to behave here and what to speak, thus my offences.

I apologize everyone whose feelings I have hurt with an open heart and promise never to cause such an inconvenience in the future.

Please forgive me and let me know.

Thanks to all.
